Splits a GRanges object by chunks, percent or size

Source: R/accessory_funcs.R
split_granges.Rd

Splits a GRanges object by chunks, percent or size

split_granges(gr, chunks = NA, percent = NA, size = NA)

Arguments

gr

GRanges; The GRanges object
chunks

integer; The total number of desired chunks (rounded up to nearest int)
percent

numeric; The percentage of overall CpGs in each chunk
size

integer; The number of CpGs to include in each chunk

Value

GRangesList containing all the chunked GRanges

Details

Divides each region GRanges into equally-sized lists based on a chunking parameter. If len(gr) %% number != 0, then the last vector will have a length of less than size number

Examples

regions <- GenomicRanges::GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", ranges = IRanges(1,100))
regions <- bin_granges(regions,bin_size=1)
split_granges(regions, chunks=10)

#> GRangesList object of length 10:
#> [[1]]
#> GRanges object with 10 ranges and 0 metadata columns:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle>
#>    [1]     chr1         1      *
#>    [2]     chr1         2      *
#>    [3]     chr1         3      *
#>    [4]     chr1         4      *
#>    [5]     chr1         5      *
#>    [6]     chr1         6      *
#>    [7]     chr1         7      *
#>    [8]     chr1         8      *
#>    [9]     chr1         9      *
#>   [10]     chr1        10      *
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> GRanges object with 10 ranges and 0 metadata columns:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle>
#>    [1]     chr1        11      *
#>    [2]     chr1        12      *
#>    [3]     chr1        13      *
#>    [4]     chr1        14      *
#>    [5]     chr1        15      *
#>    [6]     chr1        16      *
#>    [7]     chr1        17      *
#>    [8]     chr1        18      *
#>    [9]     chr1        19      *
#>   [10]     chr1        20      *
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
#> 
#> ...
#> <8 more elements>
split_granges(regions, percent=10)
